intro: Oedera hirta, commonly known as the hairy oedera, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features lance-shaped leaves covered in fine hairs, giving it a rough texture. Its flowers are small, clustered, and often have a distinctive purple or pink coloration. Oedera hirta is known for its ability to thrive in arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native environment.
